DESCRIPTION:
Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.

This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.
This bottle has been signed by Bob Dalgarno.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

Juras very own version of Feis Ile is called 'Tastival' and this is their 2016 offering. 
It has been matured with a 'triple finish' in Palomino Fino, Amoroso Oloroso and Apostoles Oloroso Sherry casks.

The Inaugural bottling was such a huge success at their private auction at the distillery they decided to release a small batch.
This series is ongoing and this expression has been matured 3 years in European oak and ex-sherry casks.

Full Volume by Highland Park was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2017 from 481 casks.  The single malt was matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks and was bottled at 47.2% ABV and comes presented in a themed presentation box resembling speaker.
This 2007 vintage Highland Park was bottled in 206 by Gordon & MacPhail form casks No: 15603510 - 15603515 at the cask strength of 58.8%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tomatin - Cu Bocan (Sherry Cask) Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: Named after the mythical creature that stalked Tomatin villagers for centuries. A limited-edition fully sherry-cask-matured expression of Cù Bòcan.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 11 Year Old 2007 Berry Bro's & Rudd
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled by the famous Berry Bros at 11 years of age, this Islay single malt comes from Caol Ila. Bottled at cask strength 51%, this malt was originally distilled in 2007. 
Bottled in 2019 & Cask Ref: 319478
Launched to celebrate the round the world yacht race in July 2014, this Old Pulteney Clipper Commemorative bottle was matured in both ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks.
A 2001 vintage Highland Park originally released for the travel retail market, which was distilled in 2001 and bottled in 2012. Made with a high proportion of first-fill American oak casks.

Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

This is an older style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers. This is a 1-litre bottling.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Vintage Cask - Peaty Single Malt
DESCRIPTION: Glenfiddich Vintage Cask Peaty Single Malt comes from a combination of European and American oaks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Ambassador's Choice
DESCRIPTION: Aged for 10 years in a combination of sherry seasoned American and European oak casks and bottled at 46% ABV.  This expression was chosen by Danish brand ambassador Martin Markvardsen.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

This is the first release in a four-part limited edition series, released in 2016. The  Bowmore's Vault Edition series will explore four of the characteristics found in Bowmore's whiskies after maturing in their No.1 Vaults maturation warehouse. This first release is the Atlantic Sea Salt edition -  the Atlantic sea spray that washes against the iconic sea-facing wall of Bowmore’s legendary No.1 Vaults is a key note in this release.
This is a 70cl bottle of luxurious vodkka, distilled using water from the Grande Champagne area of Cognac and endures a five-stage distillation process before hitting the glass.

Matured in American Oak casks this malt was aged for 14 years.
Since 2002, the distillery has dedicated one week each year to run heavily peated barley through the whisky-making process creating a distinctly different Balvenie.

Distilled in 2009 and finished in Caribbean rum barrels for one year, this 10-year-old Tomatin.  This is a limited edition of only 7,200 bottles produced at 46% ABV. It has notes of tropical fruit and chocolate in this exotic Highland dram.

This is an older style bottling of Johnnie Walker Red Label, believed to have been released in the 1970s.
Johnnie Walker Red Label was launched in its current form by brothers George and Alexander Walker in 1909, though it had existed as Walker's Special Old Highland Red Label for some years previously. Today it is one of the worlds most popular blends.

Bottled by Gordon & Macphail from the Island distillery of Scapa.
Scapa distillery was opened in 1885 and embarked on a century of production involving few changes of ownership. It was silent for two years from 1934 to and then rebuilt in 1959. 
Distilled: 2001
Bottled: 2014

Bottled by Gordon & Macphail from the Island distillery of Scapa.
Scapa distillery was opened in 1885 and embarked on a century of production involving few changes of ownership. It was silent for two years from 1934 to and then rebuilt in 1959. 
Distilled: 2005
Bottled: 2017

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

Bottled by Gordon & Macphail from the Island distillery of Scapa.
Scapa distillery was opened in 1885 and embarked on a century of production involving few changes of ownership. It was silent for two years from 1934 to and then rebuilt in 1959. 
Distilled: 2005
Bottled: 2017

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.
A travel exclusive single malt from Kininvie distillery in Speyside. This 1996 vintage 17-Year-Old was matured in 80% American oak and 20% in European sherry oak casks.

Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is a limited edition and is their Private Reserve, bottled in August 2019, this is one of only 7680 bottles available.

From the Isle of Skye Talisker 10 Year Old from the 1990s.This older style of the packaging features the Isle of Skye mapped on a stone. 
Talisker was originally formed in 1930 by Kenneth and Hugh Macaskill.   The two gentlemen are in fact brothers. The fire in November 1960 resulted in a new distillery being built which included two new stills. Now part of Diagio classic malt line up, a great one for island collectors and lovers of the Isle of Skye.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

Glenmorangie thoughts and the public opinion on this bottle is somewhat divided. It is an official 'crowd-sourced' whisky.
The whisky characteristics were decided by Glenmorangie's 'Cask Masters' and it was matured in ex-bourbon wood before being finished in Manzanilla casks.

The Seale family own the Foursquare distillery where you can trace their roots back to the 1650's in Barbados. At least 5 generations of Rum making masters have come before and their skills have been used many years before the formation of the foursquare brand. 
Foursquare would be seen as one if not the leading forces in the Rum industry and we don't believe that will change.
This fine Basian fine rum is part of the exceptional single cask range Mark X.
Aged for 12 years from an Ex-bourbon cask it was released in 2019.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Foursquare - 12 Year Old Sagacity Single Rum
DESCRIPTION:
The Seale family own the Foursquare distillery where you can trace their roots back to the 1650's in Barbados. At least 5 generations of Rum making masters have come before and their skills have been used many years before the formation of the foursquare brand. 
Foursquare would be seen as one if not the leading forces in the Rum industry and we don't believe that will change.
This fine Basian fine rum is part of the exceptional single cask range Mark XI.
Aged for 12 years from an Ex-bourbon and ex Madeira casks it was released in August 2019.
Distillation Process: Pot & Column blend.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Foursquare - 10 Year Old Premise Single Rum VIII
DESCRIPTION:
The Seale family own the Foursquare distillery where you can trace their roots back to the 1650's in Barbados. At least 5 generations of Rum making masters have come before and their skills have been used many years before the formation of the foursquare brand. 
Foursquare would be seen as one if not the leading forces in the Rum industry and we don't believe that will change.
This fine Basian fine rum is part of the exceptional single cask range Mark VIII
Aged for 10 years from an Ex-bourbon and ex sherry casks it was released in Jan 2018.
Distillation Process: Pot & Column blend.

This whisky is the first of the Triple Matured series released by Diageo. There are five single malts in the series, aged in three different types of cask. Initial maturation has been in refill casks, then in charred American oak hogsheads and finally in refill European oak casks.  All of the whiskies were released at 48% ABV.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

The Inaugural bottling was such a huge success at their private auction at the distillery they decided to release a small batch.
This series is ongoing and this expression has been matured 3 years in European oak and ex-sherry casks.

Originally released for the Travel Retail market this non age statement whisky has Sherry-cask-matured single malt at its core.
It is named for the famous draggon longship which the Vikings used to travel in to colonise the islands in the 8th century.

This is an 8-year-old Bunnahabhain single malt Scotch whisky from a single cask - it was matured in a refill hogshead. It was distilled in 2007 and was bottled by Langside in 2015 for their Hepburn's Choice range.  This is one of 364 bottles produced.

A great story surrounding the origin of the Mackinlay brand is one of some workers from the New Zealand Antarctic Heritage Trust.
They were restoring Ernest Shackleton’s hut in the south pole and found three cases of Scotch Whisky. There were labelled Rare old Highland malt whisky, blended and bottled by Chas. Mackinlay & Co’. 
21 years old, one of their oldest age statement bottlings.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.
This 2007 vintage Highland Park was bottled in 206 by Gordon & MacPhail from casks No: 15603510 - 15603515 at the cask strength of 58.8%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benrinnes - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
Benrinnes has always been known as a malt with great substance and it is said to be down to their triple distillation process. 
This bottling is part of the highly collectable series - Flora and Fauna. 
The distillery is on the Northern shoulder of Ben Rinnes (Mountain) and is 700ft above sea level.

Named for the Dunnet Head lighthouse, this Old Pulteney single malt Scotch whisky was released as part of a travel retail series. It's an American & European oak ex-bourbon-cask matured single malt. This is a 1L bottling.

Originally released for the Travel Retail market this non age statement whisky has Sherry-cask-matured single malt at its core.
It is named for the famous draggon longship which the Vikings used to travel in to colonise the islands in the 8th century.

Highland Park, the most northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in Scotland have released this expression which is their most peated whisky thus far.
It is the final piece of the Highland Park Viking Legends trilogy puzzle.
The whisky was matured in refill casks.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Loyalty Of The Wolf
DESCRIPTION:
The 'Loyalty of the Wolf' by Highland Park is a 14-year-old single malt. This is a 1L bottling.
This bottle has been matured slowly in sherry-seasoned American oak and ex-bourbon casks at 42.3%.
'Loyalty of the Wolf' celebrates the determination, co-operation, and courage in a single malt. This whisky is both sweet and complex, displaying a fine balance of contrasts, just like the Vikings - and the wolves - themselves.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 18 Year Old Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Now discontinued this cracking and very "famous" 18 year old blended malt was favourite for many. 
Grab it while you still can.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Voyage of the Raven
DESCRIPTION:
The Voyage of the Raven was released in 2017 and is a travel retail exclusive.
Most of the spirits time in a cask was spent maturing in first-fill sherry seasoned oak casks.
A vigorous single malt whisky hailing from Islay. Smokehead Extra Rare single malt is an explosive, heavily peated whisky; not for the faint-hearted! This is a 1L bottling.
Originally released for the Travel Retail market, Talisker's Dark Storm is matured in charred oak casks to give extra spice and smoke.

This whisky spent the first 10 years of its life in a bourbon hogshead before being transferred to a first fill barrique. The palate displayed a punchy pepperiness at first sipping, thus it has been dubbed as 'Comes out Swinging.'
This is one of only 251 bottles produced.
Distilled in 1988, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 2000 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%.
This 2007 vintage Highland Park was bottled in 206 by Gordon & MacPhail form casks No: 15603510 - 15603515 at the cask strength of 58.8%.

Cutty Sark 12 Year Old is an old bottling by Berry Brothers and Rudd before they were sold to the drinks giant, Edrington.
This bottle comes with a leather case.
This Glenburgie 15 Year Old is estimated to have been bottled in the 1990s as a special distillery bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kirk and Sweeney - 18 Year Old rum
DESCRIPTION:
From the Caribean nation that is best known for its beaches and golfs resorts...and now its Rum. 
This cracking 18 year old comes from an undisclosed Dominican distillery. 
Batch: 004

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Elgin - 12 Year Old The Nectar of the Daily Dram
BOTTLER: The Nectar of the Daily Dram
DESCRIPTION:
A 12 year old from the Speyside region from the indie bottler "The Nectar of the daily dram".
This Glen Elgin was distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2019.

This exciting release by Wolfburn distillery was both their first-ever small-batch Wolfburn and the first time the distillery has created a lightly peated spirit.  This single malt was matured in 100 litre first-fill ex-bourbon casks. The name comes from where these little rascals were matured: warehouse 1, stow 28. Batch No.128 is a release of 6,000 bottles.

This is the third release in a range of small-batch single malt Scotch whisky releases from the Wolfburn distillery in Thurso.  It follows on from the acclaimed Batch No.270. 
Matured in a combination of half size first-fill ex-bourbon barrels and second-fill Oloroso sherry hogsheads.

A combination of Sherry seasoned American oak and European oak casks was used to mature this single malt.  It is part of the Warrier Series by Highland Park which was created exclusively for Duty-Free.  
This edition is named after one of the most important figures in the history of the Vikings, Harald - was central to the founding of the Orkney Earldom.

Bottled by Gordon & Macphail from the Island distillery of Scapa.
Scapa distillery was opened in 1885 and embarked on a century of production involving few changes of ownership. It was silent for two years from 1934 to and then rebuilt in 1959. 
Distilled: 2005
Bottled: 2018

Said to be more sherried than their usual outturns.
Only available to the US market. This is a 75cl bottling.

Named for the Noss Head lighthouse, near Wick), this Old Pulteney single malt Scotch whisky was released as part of a travel retail series in 2013. It's an American oak ex-bourbon-cask matured single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St Ola - 2010 8 Year Old - Orcadian Blended Malt/The Whisky Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
This blended Orcadian malt was matured in a refill sherry hogshead, this single cask of vatted malt was distilled in Kirkwall 1st April 2010 and bottled 28th August 2018 for The Whisky Barrel Ltd.
This is one of only 82 bottles produced.

Highland Park Saltire Edition 2 is a 13 year old single malt whisky.
A great partnership between F1 legend David Coulthard and Highland Park, to reflect his 13 Grand Prix wins.
"David collaborated with us to create a whisky that would enable him to give something back to Dumfries and Galloway, to the region and the people who supported him from his earliest days in Formula 1."

Highland Park Saltire Edition 2 is a 13 year old single malt whisky.
A great partnership between F1 legend David Coulthard and Highland Park, to reflect his 13 Grand Prix wins.
"David collaborated with us to create a whisky that would enable him to give something back to Dumfries and Galloway, to the region and the people who supported him from his earliest days in Formula 1."

Launched in March 2010, for the travel retail market, Highland Park Leif Eriksson Limited Edition was released to celebrate the first European to reach America over a thousand years ago.  The single malt was matured in American oak casks, both ex-bourbon and ex-sherry in recognition of Leif Eriksson, a pioneering Viking explorer, as the first European man to set foot on American soil.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cask Orkney - 18 Year Old Single Malt - A.D. Rattray
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by A.D. Rattray that is said to capture the island spirit of Orkney. 
Originally a trader of wine, Italian spirits and olive oil Mr Rattray turned his hand to Whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cask Orkney - 18 Year Old Single Malt - A.D. Rattray
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by A.D. Rattray that is said to capture the island spirit of Orkney. 
Originally a trader of wine, Italian spirits and olive oil Mr Rattray turned his hand to Whisky.

The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cask Orkney - 18 Year Old Single Malt - A.D. Rattray
DESCRIPTION:
Produced by A.D. Rattray that is said to capture the island spirit of Orkney. 
Originally a trader of wine, Italian spirits and olive oil Mr Rattray turned his hand to Whisky.

This release in 2013 just so happened to coincide with the Brand sponsoring the round the world race (sailing).
The liquid held within was matured in both ex-sherry casks and bourbon casks.
This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat. This bottle is Original series which is a newer release.

Einar is from Highland Park's travel retail Warrior series.  It is named after Einar Sigurdsson who is documented in the Orkneyinga Saga as 'hard and successful man' that once ruled Orkney, where the Highland Park distillery resides.  This single malt has been matured in Sherry seasoned American and European oak casks.  Warm flavours of zesty dried orange peel and vanilla pods sweetly unfold in each dram of Einar.

This Tomatin 12 Year Old was released prior to 2014 as it was bottled at 40% (after 2014, it was bottled at 43%) It was matured in a bourbon cask and finished in Spanish sherry casks. The result is a sweet whisky with notes of apples, citrus and sweet spice.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Spirit Of The Bear
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle, Spirit of the Bear by Highland Park has intense aromatic smokiness from their unique treeless peat.
Intensely smoky with a bold spiciness, Spirit of the Bears is inspired by the resilient nature and fierce independence of the Viking ancestors - characteristics that sit at the heart of whisky-making at Highland Park.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ballantines - 17 Year Old Signature Distillery Scapa
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling has a larger % of Scapa than usual, which is certainly not a bad thing.
Ballantine's 17 year old is said the be the price of the Master blender. A special whisky with smooth taste and round finish.

A litre bottling of Laphroaig's QA Cask single malt Scotch whisky. The name comes from the Latin phrase 'Quercus Alba', meaning white oak. This single malt is double matured - it was initially matured in ex-bourbon barrels before a finishing period in charred American white oak casks.
This bottling was originally released for Travel Retail - this bottle is an import.

This Laphroaig has been matured in four different types of casks; virgin American oak barrels, European oak hogsheads, ex-bourbon barrels & small quarter casks. Originally released as a travel retail exclusive
Glendronach 12  Year Old - Original was double cask matured in sherry wood and traditional oak barrels.

Valknut is the first of Highland Park’s new Viking Legend series. Valkyrie & Valhalla are the other releases in this series.
Valknut has been matured predominantly in sherry-seasoned American oak. This series was created in partnership with Danish designer Jim Lyngvild.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St Ola - 2010 8 Year Old - Orcadian Blended Malt/The Whisky Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
This blended Orcadian malt was matured in a refill sherry hogshead, this single cask of vatted malt was distilled in Kirkwall 1st April 2010 and bottled 28th August 2018 for The Whisky Barrel Ltd.
This is one of only 82 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Timorous Beastie - 10 Year Old (Douglas Laing) Small Batch #1
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition bottling of this 10 year old small batch #1. The Timorous Beastie 10 Year Old  Highland blended malt Scotch whisky was matured for 10 years and has been bottled at 46.8% ABV. It has tasting sweet tasting notes including warm syrup over sponge and ripe, juicy nectarines.

Scapa describes Glansa as a gentle introduction to the world of peated whisky. American oak cask matured Scapa single malt Scotch whisky finished in peated casks, to create a smoky finish on their signature smooth fruity malt.
This old presentation style Glen Moray malt was aged for 12 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenalba - 22 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Sold by the supermarket chain Lidl, this blended whisky was bottled by the Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Company.
This blend is a minimum of 22 years old and has a sherry cask finish.

Glen Garioch distillery was founded in 1797 by John Manson, making it amongst the oldest distilleries in Scotland. It is known for it's heavy, thick, cereal and spicy notes, which are attributed to its short fermentation period. In 1908 the distillery was bought over by Sanderson & Son, before merging with Booth's Distilleries and then DCL by 1937. Sadly, by this point production was slowing down, and in 1968 things finally came to a halt, closing down the operation due to struggles with water supply.
Thankfully in 1973, Stanley P. Morrison, owner of Bowmore and Auchentoshan, came to the rescue; securing a new water source and reopening the distillery. He also introduced innovative heat recovery systems, which were not just of benefit to the distillery, but the surrounding town as well, heating greenhouses and the local swimming pool.
This Glen Garioch has been aged for 15 years in the Aberdeenshire village of Old Meldrum.
A rare higher-strength version of enduringly popular Johnnie Walker named after the way the bottle 'swings' back and forth.
This malt is often considered the flagship expression from Clynelish Distillery - the successor to Brora Distillery which closed in 1983. This is a well rounded Highland malt.
This old presentation style Glen Moray malt was aged for 12 years.

This is the second release of Ailsa Bay's Sweet Smoke - it has had a redesign from its first release. The 1.2 is said to be both smokier and sweeter than before. It scientifically distilled to 022 parts peat and 019 parts sweet.

Produced and bottled by MacDonald and Muir Ltd, this expression has the title Skibo. For those who don't live in the North of Scotland, this name may not carry much meaning. It is in fact a very exclusive hotel and club in the Highlands for which this whisky was produced for. 
Could it be Glenmorangie, Tomatin, Balblair...we will let you decide should you win!

A Highland Park special edition to celebrate 50 years of the Scottish Ballet. 
Released in 2019 this is one of 5000 bottles. A donation from Highland Park will go to The Scottish ballet for every bottle sold.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

Launched in March 2010, for the travel retail market, Highland Park Leif Eriksson Limited Edition was released to celebrate the first European to reach America over a thousand years ago.  The single malt was matured in American oak casks, both ex-bourbon and ex-sherry in recognition of Leif Eriksson, a pioneering Viking explorer, as the first European man to set foot on American soil.

This 10 year old single malt is a great example of some of Fettercairns best whisky, this is an older discontinued botting.  Fettercairn, owned by Whyte and Mackay distillers, is a Highland distillery.

This single malt was awarded The Chairman’s Trophy in the 2017 Ultimate Spirits Challenge, scoring 99 out of 100.

This is the relatively more heavily peated version of the single malt, made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.
This 8 Year Old Glendronach was matured and married in a combination of the finest bourbon & sherry casks.

Released to honour Alan Winchester, Master Distiller at the Glenlivet distillery since 2009. This whisky was matured in European oak butts and first-fill American barrels as well as refill hogsheads. It was originally released for the travel retail market.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - Game of Thrones - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited-edition 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar and it is part of Diagio's 2018 collaboration with HBO.  Each single malt in the series relates to the land of houses of the Game of Thrones television series.  The Royal Lochnagar bottle is decorated with a rampant black Stag, the sigil of House Baratheon that once flew on banners above the Stormlands and King’s Landing signifying absolute power.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalwhinnie - Winters Frost - Game of Thrones - House of Stark
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo have collaborated with HBO to release a limited edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
The lords of House Stark ruled as King in the North for generations, in the vast cold expanse of the northern lands of Westeros. The Stark's resilience, strength and ability to thrive in the most intense situations are greatly shaped by Winterfell's frigid temperatures. Like House Stark, Dalwhinnie is made in one of the highest and coldest distilleries in Scotland, and its extreme conditions are responsible for shaping its signature flavour.
Matured in 100% ex-bourbon casks, this Highland single malt has a uniquely floral, honeyed character. The palate has rich manuka honey and fresh figs, developing into malt balls before a rich fruit cake finish.

A great story surrounding the origin of the Mackinlay brand is one of some workers from the New Zealand Antarctic Heritage Trust.
They were restoring Ernest Shackleton’s hut in the south pole and found three cases of Scotch Whisky. There were labelled Rare old Highland malt whisky, blended and bottled by Chas. Mackinlay & Co’. 
This bottling is a minimum of 12 years of age.

Dalwhinnie Winter's Gold was introduced in 2015 inspired by its location in the Highland's of Scotland, making it one of the highest and coldest distilleries - "Crafted by the Cold".  It is made exclusively with the spirit that has been distilled between October and March.

Johnnie Walker Double Black is a full-bodied whisky that is smoky with layers of spice.  It is inspired by the iconic Johnnie Walker Black Label.  It is strongly influenced by the powerful West Coast and Island whiskies.

Talisker single malt scotch whisky is from the oldest distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Talisker Skye was introduced in early 2015, named after the beautiful island on which the distillery resides. It has been matured in a combination of refill and toasted American oak casks, with a slightly higher proportion of toasted casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Dufftown - Spey Cascade
DESCRIPTION: The Spey Cascade release was inspired by the top fishing available on the River Spey - the front label also features a fish.  This whisky was matured in a mixture of sherry and Bourbon casks, resulting in a balanced and complex dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Dufftown - Spey Cascade
DESCRIPTION: The Spey Cascade release was inspired by the top fishing available on the River Spey - the front label also features a fish.  This whisky was matured in a mixture of sherry and Bourbon casks, resulting in a balanced and complex dram.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 yo Whisky has won many awards. Lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.

The first official bottling of Tamnavulin for more than two decades. The Double Cask has been aged in American oak and finished in sherry butts. The result is a whisky with notes of dried orange, ginger and wood spice.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cardhu Gold Reserve - Game of Thrones - House Targaryen
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Cardhu Gold Reserve 'House Targaryen' is part of the Game of Thrones collection by Diageo.

It would be fair this would be the most recognisable Canadian Whisky. At 100 proof this specific bottling has been labelled export strength. 
Time to try Candian Dram?

Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2%, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.

Johnnie Walker Double Black is a full-bodied whisky that is smoky with layers of spice.  It is inspired by the iconic Johnnie Walker Black Label.  It is strongly influenced by the powerful West Coast and Island whiskies.

Cardhu is known for being an easy-drinking and sweeter style of whisky. This Gold Reserve Cask Selection has been made with the finest Cardhu casks; the whisky has been aged in toasted oak casks, which has led to notes of toffee apples whisky.

This triple distilled single malt scotch whisky from the Auchentoshan Distillery comes from a first fill North American oak casks. This bottling has a vanilla and coconut sweetness from a first fill bourbon casks.
Chivas 12 Year Old is a multi-award winning premier scotch whisky, an artful blend of many different malt and grain scotch whiskies, matured for at least 12 years.
Tailfire is one of two 2014 releases from The Singleton of Dufftown. Aged in a combination of European and American oak casks, it is a vibrant, fruity and fresh whisky.

First revealed towards the end of 2014, the Founder's Reserve was to replace The Glenlivet 12 year old in many mature markets (despite initial indications that it would sit beside it).  The bottling is named in tribute to distillery founder George Smith.

Dalwhinnie Winter's Gold was introduced in 2015 inspired by its location in the Highland's of Scotland, making it one of the highest and coldest distilleries - "Crafted by the Cold".  It is made exclusively with the spirit that has been distilled between October and March.

Highland Park Dragon Legend
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.
This is the second batch of Tweeddale Blend. This batch features single malts which have been aged for between 12 and 21 years as well as 15-year-old sherry butt-matured grain whisky.
Big "T" is a blend produced by the Tomatin Distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Inchgower - 8 Year Old 2008 - Hepburn's Choice (Langside Distillers) - 20cl
DESCRIPTION: This is an 8-year-old Inchgower single malt scotch whisky, from a single cask.  It was distilled in 2008 and was bottled by Langside in 2016 for their Hepburn's Choice range. This is a 20cl bottling.
This blended whisky from William Grant & Sons was awarded a Silver medal at the 2007 International Wine and Spirits Competition.  This blend includes whisky from Glenfiddich & Balvenie.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label
DESCRIPTION: Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.
Seagram's Five Star 75cl is a Canadian Rye "whiskey".

Gordon Highlanders scotch whisky is a blended whisky.  It is named after the Gordon Highlanders regiment of the British Army.  This bottling celebrates the Bicentenary of the Gordon Highlanders Regiment 1794-1994 which was named after the Clan Gordon.
A bottle of The Tormore Glenlivet 10 Year Old, estimated to be bottled in the 1980s.

Ballantine's Gold Seal takes in 40 of Scotlands greatest malts. It was matured in Oak casks for 12 years or more to produce this lovely 'liquid gold' blend.

A 1990/2000s release of Glen Grant 10 Year Old.
Glen Grant 10 Year old has won multiple awards including: Winner of Best Single Malt Scotch Whisky 10 Years and Under in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2013.

This a 10 year old Macallan 5cl miniature bottle. 
Macallan is arguably the most collectable malt in the world.  There has also been a real shift towards miniature whiskies in the Asian market recently which could make this lot very collectable indeed.

The 12-year-old is Glenfiddich is Glenfiddich's signature malt.
It has been aged for a total of 12 years in both Oloroso Sherry and Bourbon Cask.
A bottle of Kenmore Blended Scotch Whisky bottled for Marks & Spencer.
This is bottling of Famous Grouse Jubilee, celebrates Her Majesty the Queens 60 years on the throne.  This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

Isle of Skye 8 year old has its origins in that most celebrated of Scottish islands: Skye, home of the Clan Macleod.
Ian Macleod, the founder of 'Isle of Skye' was justifiably proud of his families 19th-century recipe, which contains a high proportion of carefully selected Island and Speyside malts.
Its smoothness, mellowness and quality are guaranteed by the fact that every whisky in recipe has been mellowed in oak casks for at least 8 years - the recognised age of maturity for many malt whiskies.
An 8-year-old, blended, Scotch whisky from the long-running Highland Queen range.
This a litre bottle of a long-running brand in blended Scotch whisky, famous since 1826 and founded by Peter Mackenzie.

This is a 1-litre bottling of Ballantine's Finest Scotch Whisky blended from more than 50 single malts (with particular emphasis on Miltonduff and Glenburgie) as well as 4 single grain whiskies. Ballantine's Finest is a smooth, satisfyingly modern blend, now picking up serious momentum in overseas markets under owners Chivas Brothers.
This Bell's Special Reserve is their new recipe only using malt whisky and having a subtle tang of Islay smoke in the mix.

This Canadian Club was aged in white oak casks, it is a barrel blended Canadian whisky.

This long-established standard blend was named after the legendary ‘Long John’ Macdonald, who founded Ben Nevis distillery. Its malt was supposedly a key ingredient, though Long John’s core later became Tormore, which began distilling in 1961.
An 8-year-old, blended, Scotch whisky from the long-running Highland Queen range.

Barrogill is a blended whisky based upon the Highland style, it was actually blended by His Royal Highness Prince Charles.  In 1952, Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth, The Queen Mother first saw Barrowgill Castle - she went on to buy the rundown castle, restored it and changed the name to Castle of Mey - as it is still known now.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: New Make Spirit - Dornoch Distillery - Thompson Bros
DESCRIPTION:
This is a bottling by Thompson Bros which is a new make spirit from Dornoch Distillery. Made from organic floor malted plummgae archer. It was fermented in open top oak for 7-10 days. It was bottled in August 2019 at 60% ABV.
This is a 20cl bottling.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

This is a 1-litre bottling of Ballantine's Finest Scotch Whisky blended from more than 50 single malts (with particular emphasis on Miltonduff and Glenburgie) as well as 4 single grain whiskies. Ballantine's Finest is a smooth, satisfyingly modern blend, now picking up serious momentum in overseas markets under owners Chivas Brothers.

This is part of the core range from George Ballantine & Sons.
12 year old blended Scotch Whisky in 750ml

A great looking bottle of blended Scotch whisky.
It was matured in a combination of bourbon casks.

A 35cl bottling.  Highland Park 12 Year Old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."

A great little half bottle of the Orcadian Highland Park 10 Year Old. 
It is an age statement that hasn't been used too many times in the past.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mackinlay - The Original Finest Old Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
A great story surrounding the origin of the Mackinlay brand is one of some workers from the New Zealand Antarctic Heritage Trust.
They were restoring Ernest Shackleton’s hut in the south pole and found three cases of Scotch Whisky. There were labelled Rare old Highland malt whisky, blended and bottled by Chas. Mackinlay & Co’. 
This specific bottling was labelled the Finest Old Scotch Whisky.

A great little half bottle of the Orcadian Highland Park 10 Year Old. 
It is an age statement that hasn't been used too many times in the past.

This is an older style bottling of Mackinlay's 12 year old Legacy blended whisky. The brand is the same one that Shackleton shipped to Antartica for the Nimrod expedition in 1907. It is estimated that this bottle dates from the 1980s.  This is a 75cl bottling.

This is a 20cl bottling - A lightly peated single malt made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.
This is a 5cl bottling.  A collectable bottle of Bunnahabhain 12-year-old single malt.

Fraiser blended Scotch whisky liqueur is from an original recipe containing a special blend of Rare and Old scotch whiskies steeped in fragrant strawberries & aged in American Oak Barrels. John Smith was the Malt Master that oversaw the project.
This a 5cl bottle of the classic 15 Year Old deluxe blend. Based on Glenkinchie with traces of other more northerly distilleries, Dimple benefits from an extended marrying period.

Blair Athol was built back in 1798, in a small town in Perthshire Scotland - Pitlochry. It is one of the oldest distilleries in Scotland.
Diageo now owns this distillery and it is quite rare to see a bottle with the original labels.
Inchgower 12 a deluxe Highland malt whisky (actually Speyside) from the House of Bells.
